description: Provides cluster-level details including status, hardware and software configuration, VPC settings, and so on.

parameters.name: ClusterId
parameters.description: The identifier of the cluster to describe.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the cluster.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the cluster. This parameter can't contain the characters <, >, $, |, or ` (backtick).

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The current state of the cluster.

nested_items.name: StateChangeReason
nested_items.description: The reason for the cluster status change.

nested_items.name: Code
nested_items.description: The programmatic code for the state change reason.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: The descriptive message for the state change reason.

nested_items.name: CreationDateTime
nested_items.description: The creation date and time of the cluster.

nested_items.name: ReadyDateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the cluster was ready to run steps.

nested_items.name: EndDateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the cluster was terminated.

nested_items.name: ErrorDetails
nested_items.description: A list of tuples that provides information about the errors that caused a cluster to terminate. This structure can contain up to 10 different ErrorDetail tuples.

nested_items.name: ErrorCode
nested_items.description: The name or code associated with the error.

nested_items.name: ErrorData
nested_items.description: A list of key value pairs that provides contextual information about why an error occured.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: A message that describes the error.

nested_items.name: Ec2InstanceAttributes
nested_items.description: Provides information about the Amazon EC2 instances in a cluster grouped by category. For example, key name, subnet ID, IAM instance profile, and so on.

nested_items.name: Ec2KeyName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon EC2 key pair to use when connecting with SSH into the master node as a user named 'hadoop'.

nested_items.name: Ec2SubnetId
nested_items.description: Set this parameter to the identifier of the Amazon VPC subnet where you want the cluster to launch. If you do not specify this value, and your account supports EC2-Classic, the cluster launches in EC2-Classic.

nested_items.name: RequestedEc2SubnetIds
nested_items.description: Applies to clusters configured with the instance fleets option. Specifies the unique identifier of one or more Amazon EC2 subnets in which to launch Amazon EC2 cluster instances. Subnets must exist within the same VPC. Amazon EMR chooses the Amazon EC2 subnet with the best fit from among the list of RequestedEc2SubnetIds, and then launches all cluster instances within that Subnet. If this value is not specified, and the account and Region support EC2-Classic networks, the cluster launches instances in the EC2-Classic network and uses RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones instead of this setting. If EC2-Classic is not supported, and no Subnet is specified, Amazon EMR chooses the subnet for you. RequestedEc2SubnetIDs and RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones cannot be specified together.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Ec2AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone in which the cluster will run.

nested_items.name: RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones
nested_items.description: Applies to clusters configured with the instance fleets option. Specifies one or more Availability Zones in which to launch Amazon EC2 cluster instances when the EC2-Classic network configuration is supported. Amazon EMR chooses the Availability Zone with the best fit from among the list of RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones, and then launches all cluster instances within that Availability Zone. If you do not specify this value, Amazon EMR chooses the Availability Zone for you. RequestedEc2SubnetIDs and RequestedEc2AvailabilityZones cannot be specified together.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: IamInstanceProfile
nested_items.description: The IAM role that was specified when the cluster was launched. The Amazon EC2 instances of the cluster assume this role.

nested_items.name: EmrManagedMasterSecurityGroup
nested_items.description: The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the master node.

nested_items.name: EmrManagedSlaveSecurityGroup
nested_items.description: The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the core and task nodes.

nested_items.name: ServiceAccessSecurityGroup
nested_items.description: The identifier of the Amazon EC2 security group for the Amazon EMR service to access clusters in VPC private subnets.

nested_items.name: AdditionalMasterSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the master node.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AdditionalSlaveSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: A list of additional Amazon EC2 security group IDs for the core and task nodes.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InstanceCollectionType
nested_items.description: The instance group configuration of the cluster. A value of INSTANCE_GROUP indicates a uniform instance group configuration. A value of INSTANCE_FLEET indicates an instance fleets configuration.

nested_items.name: LogUri
nested_items.description: The path to the Amazon S3 location where logs for this cluster are stored.

nested_items.name: LogEncryptionKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The KMS key used for encrypting log files. This attribute is only available with Amazon EMR 5.30.0 and later, excluding Amazon EMR 6.0.0.

nested_items.name: RequestedAmiVersion
nested_items.description: The AMI version requested for this cluster.

nested_items.name: RunningAmiVersion
nested_items.description: The AMI version running on this cluster.

nested_items.name: ReleaseLabel
nested_items.description: The Amazon EMR release label, which determines the version of open-source application packages installed on the cluster. Release labels are in the form emr-x.x.x, where x.x.x is an Amazon EMR release version such as emr-5.14.0. For more information about Amazon EMR release versions and included application versions and features, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/emr/latest/ReleaseGuide/. The release label applies only to Amazon EMR releases version 4.0 and later. Earlier versions use AmiVersion.

nested_items.name: AutoTerminate
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the cluster should terminate after completing all steps.

nested_items.name: TerminationProtected
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Amazon EMR will lock the cluster to prevent the Amazon EC2 instances from being terminated by an API call or user intervention, or in the event of a cluster error.

nested_items.name: UnhealthyNodeReplacement
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Amazon EMR should gracefully replace Amazon EC2 core instances that have degraded within the cluster.

nested_items.name: VisibleToAllUsers
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the cluster is visible to IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account associated with the cluster. When true, IAM principals in the Amazon Web Services account can perform Amazon EMR cluster actions on the cluster that their IAM policies allow. When false, only the IAM principal that created the cluster and the Amazon Web Services account root user can perform Amazon EMR actions, regardless of IAM permissions policies attached to other IAM principals.

nested_items.name: Applications
nested_items.description: The applications installed on this cluster.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the application.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The version of the application.

nested_items.name: Args
nested_items.description: Arguments for Amazon EMR to pass to the application.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AdditionalInfo
nested_items.description: This option is for advanced users only. This is meta information about third-party applications that third-party vendors use for testing purposes.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: A list of tags associated with a cluster.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: A user-defined key, which is the minimum required information for a valid tag. For more information, see Tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: A user-defined value, which is optional in a tag. For more information, see Tag Clusters.

nested_items.name: ServiceRole
nested_items.description: The IAM role that Amazon EMR assumes in order to access Amazon Web Services resources on your behalf.

nested_items.name: NormalizedInstanceHours
nested_items.description: An approximation of the cost of the cluster, represented in m1.small/hours. This value is incremented one time for every hour an m1.small instance runs. Larger instances are weighted more, so an Amazon EC2 instance that is roughly four times more expensive would result in the normalized instance hours being incremented by four. This result is only an approximation and does not reflect the actual billing rate.

nested_items.name: MasterPublicDnsName
nested_items.description: The DNS name of the master node. If the cluster is on a private subnet, this is the private DNS name. On a public subnet, this is the public DNS name.

nested_items.name: Configurations
nested_items.description: Applies only to Amazon EMR releases 4.x and later. The list of configurations that are supplied to the Amazon EMR cluster.

nested_items.name: Classification
nested_items.description: The classification within a configuration.

nested_items.name: Configurations
nested_items.description: A list of additional configurations to apply within a configuration object.

nested_items.name: Properties
nested_items.description: A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityConfiguration
nested_items.description: The name of the security configuration applied to the cluster.

nested_items.name: AutoScalingRole
nested_items.description: An IAM role for automatic scaling policies. The default role is EMR_AutoScaling_DefaultRole. The IAM role provides permissions that the automatic scaling feature requires to launch and terminate Amazon EC2 instances in an instance group.

nested_items.name: ScaleDownBehavior
nested_items.description: The way that individual Amazon EC2 instances terminate when an automatic scale-in activity occurs or an instance group is resized. TERMINATE_AT_INSTANCE_HOUR indicates that Amazon EMR terminates nodes at the instance-hour boundary, regardless of when the request to terminate the instance was submitted. This option is only available with Amazon EMR 5.1.0 and later and is the default for clusters created using that version. TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION indicates that Amazon EMR adds nodes to a deny list and drains tasks from nodes before terminating the Amazon EC2 instances, regardless of the instance-hour boundary. With either behavior, Amazon EMR removes the least active nodes first and blocks instance termination if it could lead to HDFS corruption. TERMINATE_AT_TASK_COMPLETION is available only in Amazon EMR releases 4.1.0 and later, and is the default for versions of Amazon EMR earlier than 5.1.0.

nested_items.name: CustomAmiId
nested_items.description: Available only in Amazon EMR releases 5.7.0 and later. The ID of a custom Amazon EBS-backed Linux AMI if the cluster uses a custom AMI.

nested_items.name: EbsRootVolumeSize
nested_items.description: The size, in GiB, of the Amazon EBS root device volume of the Linux AMI that is used for each Amazon EC2 instance. Available in Amazon EMR releases 4.x and later.

nested_items.name: RepoUpgradeOnBoot
nested_items.description: Applies only when CustomAmiID is used. Specifies the type of updates that the Amazon Linux AMI package repositories apply when an instance boots using the AMI.

nested_items.name: KerberosAttributes
nested_items.description: Attributes for Kerberos configuration when Kerberos authentication is enabled using a security configuration. For more information see Use Kerberos Authentication in the Amazon EMR Management Guide.

nested_items.name: Realm
nested_items.description: The name of the Kerberos realm to which all nodes in a cluster belong. For example, EC2.INTERNAL.

nested_items.name: KdcAdminPassword
nested_items.description: The password used within the cluster for the kadmin service on the cluster-dedicated KDC, which maintains Kerberos principals, password policies, and keytabs for the cluster.

nested_items.name: CrossRealmTrustPrincipalPassword
nested_items.description: Required only when establishing a cross-realm trust with a KDC in a different realm. The cross-realm principal password, which must be identical across realms.

nested_items.name: ADDomainJoinUser
nested_items.description: Required only when establishing a cross-realm trust with an Active Directory domain. A user with sufficient privileges to join resources to the domain.

nested_items.name: ADDomainJoinPassword
nested_items.description: The Active Directory password for ADDomainJoinUser.

nested_items.name: ClusterArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name of the cluster.

nested_items.name: OutpostArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost where the cluster is launched.

nested_items.name: StepConcurrencyLevel
nested_items.description: Specifies the number of steps that can be executed concurrently.

nested_items.name: PlacementGroups
nested_items.description: Placement group configured for an Amazon EMR cluster.

nested_items.name: InstanceRole
nested_items.description: Role of the instance in the cluster.

nested_items.name: PlacementStrategy
nested_items.description: Amazon EC2 Placement Group strategy associated with instance role.

nested_items.name: OSReleaseLabel
nested_items.description: The Amazon Linux release specified in a cluster launch RunJobFlow request. If no Amazon Linux release was specified, the default Amazon Linux release is shown in the response.

nested_items.name: EbsRootVolumeIops
nested_items.description: The IOPS, of the Amazon EBS root device volume of the Linux AMI that is used for each Amazon EC2 instance. Available in Amazon EMR releases 6.15.0 and later.

nested_items.name: EbsRootVolumeThroughput
nested_items.description: The throughput, in MiB/s, of the Amazon EBS root device volume of the Linux AMI that is used for each Amazon EC2 instance. Available in Amazon EMR releases 6.15.0 and later.
